definitions.definition: a person who is travelling in a car, bus, train, plane or ship and who is not driving it or working on it

examples.text: I soon got talking to a **fellow passenger** on the flight.
a **passenger train** *(= carrying passengers, not goods)*
A taxi was picking up a passenger outside the hotel.
The bus stopped to let its passengers off.
Will all passengers for Frankfurt please go to Gate 21.
A queue of foot passengers were waiting to board the boat.
Airline passengers face steep rises in fares.
Passengers were left stranded for three hours when their train broke down.
There is no airbag on the passenger side.
The driver walked around and opened the passenger door.

definitions.definition: a member of a group or team who does not do as much work as the others

examples.text: The firm cannot afford to carry passengers.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from the Old French adjective passager ‘passing, transitory’, used as a noun, from passage, based on Latin passus ‘pace’.
